sense.name: Cultivate products or land agriculturally.
sense.examples: He farms 12 acres in Grabowiec, Poland. My son is farming in California. We farm wheat here.

sense.name: Collect fees or profit (from people).
sense.examples: He farmed the villagers for taxes and cheap labor.

sense.name: FARM OUT: arrange for contracted work to be done by others.
sense.commentary: Is: FARM OUT Note: NP2 must be a kind of work.
sense.examples: Fewer companies desire to farm out work these days. We farmed out our telemarketed to companies overseas. Don't farm out my job!

sense.name: FARM OUT: grant the services of or the temporary use of, for a fee; includes people.
sense.examples: We farm out our apartment to tourists every year. He farmed out his niece for manual labor. He farmed himself out as a cook.
